nodes.text: LeisureMech Enterprises was a manufacturer of automated machinery systems and computer-controlled processes. They also operated a small but lucrative droid design division that catered for the high-end of society, producing recreational, entertainment, and luxury droids. The company also catered to the seedier side of the leisure industry, producing cheap droids for gambling establishments. One successful branch of LeisureMech producing security droids was spun off to form Ulban Arms which netted LeisureMech a healthy profit when it was sold off. The company was based in the Corporate Sector.

LeisureMech products included the RH7 CardShark automated sabacc dealer, the C5 bartender droid, and BD-3000 luxury droid. Droids built by LeisureMech were designed with the intention of putting organics at ease including the BD-3000 which was intentionally designed to play on the allure of the female form.

LeisureMech was one of the voting sponsors of the Corporate Sector Authority, investing in the endeavor after the signing of the Corporate Sector Charter. LeisureMech went under in the wake of the Clone Wars, risking everything on their human replicant series. Customers did not take to the droids due to Eerie Coulee Disorder, a sense of unease that Humans and Humanoids felt when looking at droids with features that appeared Human, but not quite.
